abstract: Harvard and Duke are part of a trend in which institutional investors are unloading private equity assets, and this Great Unwinding of 2008 — as Fortune senior writer Michael V. Copeland calls it — offers big opportunities for buyers in the secondary market.
lead_paragraph: Harvard and Duke are part of a trend in which institutional investors are unloading private equity assets, and this Great Unwinding of 2008 — as Fortune senior writer Michael V. Copeland calls it — offers big opportunities for buyers in the secondary market.

headline.main: Private Equity Stakes For Sale, Slightly Used
